text: Yeni Yapan (, ) or al-Judaydah (), is a village in northern Aleppo Governorate, northwestern Syria. Located halfway between Azaz and al-Rai, some north of the city of Aleppo and south of the border to the Turkish province of Kilis, the village administratively belongs to Nahiya Sawran in Azaz District. Nearby localities include Dudiyan to the northeast and Murayghil to the south. In the 2004 census, al-Judaydah had a population of 63. ==References== Category:Turkmen communities in Syria
title: Al-Judaydah, Aleppo Governorate
